intro: Gamochaeta girardiana, commonly known as the slender goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, yellowish to reddish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Gamochaeta girardiana is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
